Now

This is a Now page. It contains what I‚Äôd tell a friend I hadn‚Äôt seen in a year. I‚Äôm using it as a casual version of an About page. You should make a Now page for yourself.

I‚Äôm Zinzy Waleson Geene, I‚Äôm in my mid-thirties and I have a penchant for casual web publishing

This website is a digital living room; a place where I think aloud, change my mind, and share slices of life. I think the Internet is a miraculous place, and believe we all have the right to own our stuff, and do so in a sustainable way. I suppose this means I like IndieWeb principles.

I live in Amsterdam‚Äôs finest neighborhood: de Indische Buurt.

I share my life with Anja Waleson, a high school English teacher and new ceramics enthusiast. We live in a little shoebox with a petit garden. We‚Äôre companions to puppy Lemonade, who may or may not have her own blog, let‚Äôs find out together.

In my spare time I enjoy swimming, writing, making music, and painting

With generous donations from friends, I bought myself a piano for my birthday last year. It‚Äôs a journey of rediscovering how I best learn, of what draws my attention, and of how music is the best mental health item in my toolbox. For entirely archival reasons, I‚Äôm making a little EP with self-written songs this Summer.

Aside from music, I like to spend time writing, drawing, visiting the theatre, and swimming. With the puppy it‚Äôs a bit of an adventure, but I‚Äôm hoping to settle back into my 6:30AM morning swim routine. I‚Äôve missed swimming plenty over the winter, and it might be smart to find a good indoor pool for the later months of 2023. For now, I‚Äôm pleased to know that Amsterdam‚Äôs finest outdoor pool is in our own backyard.

I‚Äôm embarking on a new professional adventure

After 2.5 years with the wonderful team of Leeruniek I joined Gerimedica in May. Onboarding there has been an absolute dream, and I‚Äôve felt a part of the family since the moment I signed the contract. I‚Äôve been given plenty of space to roam around, which means that I was able to hit the ground running, teaming up with my buddy Hans to improve not only product design, but also research and evangelism.

I‚Äôm mentoring again

After a hiatus, I‚Äôm pleased to be back on the mentoring market. With 16 years of professional experience, I‚Äôve found that my stories, many of which I had always deemed irrelevant to the world, can be of help to other people in the IT industry, specifically UX designers and researchers and product managers. If you‚Äôd like to book a session with me, you may do so via ADPList.

I‚Äôm doing my best to accept the ebb and flow of life

One of the thinking traps in which I routinely fall is the one where ‚ÄúY can happen when X is completed‚Äù. We make a plan and God laughs. I‚Äôve found that meditation helps me break this cycle. I‚Äôve been devoting time daily to a meditation session. It‚Äôs becoming easier to remember that even 10 minutes of practice is worthwhile, even when I keep comparing myself to monks on some Tibetan mountain.

I‚Äôm learning how to be kind to my neurodivergent brain

Through trial and error, I‚Äôm finding ways to help myself best learn and deliver. One thing that‚Äôs been helpful in this regard is accepting my tendency to think top-down rather than bottom-up. It‚Äôs marvellous to see how much of the world assumes a bottom-up approach to learning, communicating, and creating. YouTuber Elizabeth Filips has been of great help on this journey.
